info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 1:54PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTHEASTERN SANTA FE COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM MDT... At 153 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Galisteo, or 21 miles northeast of Moriarty, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern San Miguel and southeastern Santa Fe Counties. This includes Highway 285 between Mile Markers 257 and 276. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
